questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements :

Statement I : In 'Lassaigne's Test', when both nitrogen and sulphur are present in an organic compound, sodium thiocyanate is formed.

Statement II : If both nitrogen and sulphur are present in an organic compound, then the excess of sodium used in sodium fusion will decompose the sodium thiocyanate formed to give NaCN and Na2S.

In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below :
questions.subject: Chemistry

options.A: Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
options.B: Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
options.C: Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
options.D: Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.

questions.question:
Given below are two statements : 
Statement I : In 'Lassaigne's Test', when both nitrogen and sulphur are present in an organic compound, sodium thiocyanate is formed. 
Statement II : If both nitrogen and sulphur are present in an organic compound, then the excess of sodium used in sodium fusion will decompose the sodium thiocyanate formed to give NaCN and Na_{2}S. 
In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below :

questions.question_text:
For complete combustion of methanol

CH3OH(I) + $${3 \over 2}$$O2(g) $$\to$$ CO2(g) + 2H2O(I)

the amount of heat produced as measured by bomb calorimeter is 726 kJ mol$$-$$1 at 27$$^\circ$$C. The enthalpy of combustion for the reaction is $$-$$x kJ mol$$-$$1, where x is ___________. (Nearest integer)

(Given : R = 8.3 JK$$-$$1 mol$$-$$1)

the amount of heat produced as measured by bomb calorimeter is 726 kJ mol^{$$-$$1} at 27$$^\circ$$C. The enthalpy of combustion for the reaction is $$-$$x kJ mol^{$$-$$1}, where x is ___________. (Nearest integer) 
(Given : R = 8.3 JK^{$$-$$1} mol^{$$-$$1})

(Given : pKa (CH3COOH) = 4.76)

log 5 = 0.69

log 11 = 1.04

log 5 = 0.69

questions.question_text:
Given below two statements : One is labelled as Assertion (A) and other is labelled as Reason (R).

Assertion (A) : Non-polar materials do not have any permanent dipole moment.

Reason (R) : When a non-polar material is placed in an electric field, the centre of the positive charge distribution of it's individual atom or molecule coincides with the centre of the negative charge distribution.

In the light of above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below.
questions.subject: Physics

options.A: Both (A) and (R) are correct and (R) is the correct explanation of (A).
options.B: Both (A) and (R) are correct and (R) is not the correct explanation of (A).
options.C: (A) is correct but (R) is not correct.
options.D: (A) is not correct but (R) is correct.

questions.question:
Given below two statements : One is labelled as Assertion (A) and other is labelled as Reason (R). 
Assertion (A) : Non-polar materials do not have any permanent dipole moment. 
Reason (R) : When a non-polar material is placed in an electric field, the centre of the positive charge distribution of it's individual atom or molecule coincides with the centre of the negative charge distribution. 
In the light of above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below.

questions.question_text: A fighter jet is flying horizontally at a certain altitude with a speed of 200 ms$$-$$1. When it passes directly overhead an anti-aircraft gun, a bullet is fired from the gun, at an angle $$\theta$$ with the horizontal, to hit the jet. If the bullet speed is 400 m/s, the value of $$\theta$$ will be ___________$$^\circ$$.
questions.subject: Physics

When it passes directly overhead an anti-aircraft gun, a bullet is fired from the gun, at an angle $$\theta$$ with the horizontal, to hit the jet. If the bullet speed is 400 m/s, the value of $$\theta$$ will be ___________$$^\circ$$.

questions.question_text: A ball of mass 0.5 kg is dropped from the height of 10 m. The height, at which the magnitude of velocity becomes equal to the magnitude of acceleration due to gravity, is ________ m. [Use g = 10 m/s2]

questions.question_text: The elastic behaviour of material for linear stress and linear strain, is shown in the figure. The energy density for a linear strain of 5 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$4 is __________ kJ/m3. Assume that material is elastic upto the linear strain of 5 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$4.

questions.question_text: The elongation of a wire on the surface of the earth is 10$$-$$4 m. The same wire of same dimensions is elongated by 6 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$5 m on another planet. The acceleration due to gravity on the planet will be ____________ ms$$-$$2. (Take acceleration due to gravity on the surface of earth = 10 ms$$-$$2)

questions.question_text: A 10 $$\Omega$$, 20 mH coil carrying constant current is connected to a battery of 20 V through a switch. Now after switch is opened current becomes zero in 100 $$\mu$$s. The average e.m.f. induced in the coil is ____________ V.
questions.subject: Physics

questions.question_text: A light ray is incident, at an incident angle $$\theta$$1, on the system of tow plane mirrors M1 and M2 having an inclination angle 75$$^\circ$$ between them (as shown in figure). After reflecting from mirror M1 it gets reflected back by the mirror M2 with an angle of reflection 30$$^\circ$$. The total deviation of the ray will be _____________ degree.

(Given g = 10 ms$$-$$2)
